name: groove
content:
groove noun [C]
(NARROW SPACE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a long, narrow, hollow space cut into a surface: The window slides along a deep metal groove to open and close.
medical
  specialized a long, narrow space in the surface of a body part: There may be nerve compression at the elbow in the ulnar groove.

groove noun [C]
(RHYTHM)
informal a musical rhythm that is enjoyable and makes you want to move or dance: She opened with a tune that had a catchy groove. A memorable melody is just as important as the groove.
More examplesFewer examplesHis deep soul grooves have been a key part of his music throughout his career.

informal to dance to a rhythm, especially in quite a slow, smooth way to music such as soul, funk, or jazz: groove to He slides onstage, grooving to the beat. I'm enjoying the music, moving and grooving.
More examplesFewer examplesThey soon got the audience grooving. I enjoy grooving to old-school reggae.This is the place to groove to the funkiest acts and mingle with the hippest crowd in town.Saturdays they would eat fried chicken at a restaurant or groove away in a jazz bar.The music is so good, most people are kind of grooving in their seats.
